Project Name: Allied Architects Assn. of Los Angeles Records. Collection 1257
Summary: This collection includes architectural renderings of developments proposed between 1924-1925 by the Allied Architects Association of Los Angeles Records, an architectural firm founded in 1921 to design Los Angeles-area buildings paid for by the proceeds of public tax money. Notable members included Octavius Morgan, Reginald Johnson, Edwin Bergstrom, David C. Allison, Myron Hunt, Elmer Grey, Sumner Hunt, and Sumner Spaulding. Some of its major projects include downtown's Hall of Justice, the Bob Hope Patriotic Hall, and the Los Angeles County + USC Medical Center.
Title: Allied Architects Association of Los Angeles Records. Collection 1257
